body:
$!The Post Office Check & Send service checks that your passport application form has been filled in correctly.$!

It also:

- makes sure that you have supplied the correct documents and fee
- sends your application by special delivery

Using Check & Send is usually faster than a standard postal application - it takes a minimum of 2 weeks. However, it may take longer if the Identity & Passport Service (IPS) needs to contact you or your countersignatory for more information.

%Using the Check & Send service does not guarantee that your application for a passport will be successful.%

## How much it costs ##

Check & Send costs £8.17 on top of the [standard application fee](/passport-fees "Passport fees"). You pay this at the Post Office when you hand over your completed form. 

If you qualify for a [free passport](/free-passport "free passport"), the Check & Send service is free as well.

You can ask for a refund of the Check & Send charge if the Post Office makes a mistake when checking your form.

##Where you can use the service##

[Find your nearest Post Office that offers the Check & Send service](http://www.postoffice.co.uk/branch-finder "Find your nearest Check & Send Post Office."){:rel="external"} (choose 'Passport Check & Send' from the drop down list).

Take your completed passport application form and supporting documents to the Post Office branch.
overview: Use the Post Office passport Check & Send service to renew or get a passport and find out how much it costs
title: Passport Check & Send service
